abstract: Shares of OfficeMax climbed as much as 10 percent on Tuesday after analysts at JPMorgan Chase suggested that the office supply chain could be a good target for a buyout.
snippet: Shares of OfficeMax climbed as much as 10 percent on Tuesday after analysts at JPMorgan Chase suggested that the office supply chain could be a good target for a buyout.
lead_paragraph: After Gymboree announced Monday that it would sell itself to Bain Capital for $1.8 billion, analysts were quick to note that the children’s clothing store would probably not be the only specialty retailer to be scooped up in the next few months. That raised an inevitable question: Who might be next?

headline.main: More Retail Buyout Chatter: Is OfficeMax Next?
